trans-unit.source: Returns a numeric representation of a hexadecimal string.

seg-source.mrk: Returns a numeric representation of a hexadecimal string.

target.mrk: Returns a numeric representation of a hexadecimal string.

trans-unit.source: Can be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Can be one of the following:

target.mrk: Can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Default = string is interpreted as an integer. See remarks.

seg-source.mrk: Default = string is interpreted as an integer.

target.mrk: Default = string is interpreted as an integer.

trans-unit.source: $NUMBER_32BIT (1) = string is interpreted as a 32bit integer

seg-source.mrk: $NUMBER_32BIT (1) = string is interpreted as a 32bit integer

target.mrk: $NUMBER_32BIT (1) = string is interpreted as a 32bit integer

trans-unit.source: $NUMBER_64BIT (2) = string is interpreted as a 64bit integer

seg-source.mrk: $NUMBER_64BIT (2) = string is interpreted as a 64bit integer

target.mrk: $NUMBER_64BIT (2) = string is interpreted as a 64bit integer

trans-unit.source: $NUMBER_DOUBLE (3) = string is interpreted as a double

seg-source.mrk: $NUMBER_DOUBLE (3) = string is interpreted as a double

target.mrk: $NUMBER_DOUBLE (3) = string is interpreted as a double

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to 1 if an invalid hex string was used or if an overflow occurs.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to 1 if an invalid hex string was used or if an overflow occurs.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to 1 if an invalid hex string was used or if an overflow occurs.

trans-unit.source: Default behavior is that the input string is treated as an integer. In this case, if the result is within range of a 32bit integer then it's returned as a 32bit integer, otherwise it's returned as a 64bit integer - both signed.

seg-source.mrk: Default behavior is that the input string is treated as an integer.
In this case, if the result is within range of a 32bit integer then it's returned as a 32bit integer, otherwise it's returned as a 64bit integer - both signed.

target.mrk: Default behavior is that the input string is treated as an integer.
In this case, if the result is within range of a 32bit integer then it's returned as a 32bit integer, otherwise it's returned as a 64bit integer - both signed.
